purpose: This law protects workers and defines the relationship between employers and employees in Bhutan

working_hours.simple_explanation: You cannot be made to work more than 8 hours a day or 48 hours a week without overtime pay
working_hours.details: Normal working hours are 8 hours per day and 48 hours per week. If you work more, your employer must pay you extra (overtime).

termination.simple_explanation: Your employer cannot fire you without good reason and proper notice
termination.details: If your employer wants to fire you, they must have a valid reason and give you proper notice (usually 1 month). They must follow the correct procedure.

salary_payment.simple_explanation: Your employer must pay your agreed salary on time every month
salary_payment.details: Your salary must be paid regularly as agreed in your contract. Your employer cannot delay or reduce your salary without valid reasons.

workplace_safety.simple_explanation: Your workplace must be safe and your employer must provide safety equipment
workplace_safety.details: Your employer must ensure your workplace is safe and provide necessary safety equipment and training. You have the right to refuse dangerous work.

annual_leave.simple_explanation: You are entitled to paid vacation days every year
annual_leave.details: After working for one year, you get at least 10 days of paid annual leave. This increases with years of service.

common_violations: Making employees work excessive hours without overtime pay
Firing employees without proper notice or reason

how_to_get_help.first_step: Try to resolve the issue with your employer directly
how_to_get_help.second_step: Contact the Ministry of Labour and Human Resources

contact.address: Ministry of Labour and Human Resources, Thimphu
